instructions.text: Take MOUNTING_BRACKET_ASSEMBLY.
instructions.picture_description: Image of a mounting bracket assembly.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Insert the BUTTON_EXTENSION for the reset button into the MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Two images showing a hand holding a translucent component with an insertion point for a button extension.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Insert Motor with flexible PCBA halfway into the main body.
instructions.picture_description: A hand is inserting a component with a green circuit board into a circular white casing.

instructions.text: Insert button extension half way into the Main body.
Afterwards the motor can be pushed down to his final position as well as the button extension.
instructions.picture_description: A close-up of a circular component with yellow markings showing alignment positions.

instructions.text: Attach the motor and FPCBA to the housing by inserting the two MOTOR_SCREWs.
instructions.picture_description: A hand holding the completed assembly with visible screw positions.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Insert MOUNTING_BUTTON_EXTENSION for the mounting button into MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing insertion of button extension into a circular main body.

instructions.text: Put GEAR into the opening of the rotary encoder on PPCBA.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing a gear being placed into an opening on a small circuit board.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary

Placing the PCBA in Main Body

Make sure that the PCBA is positioned in the MAIN BODY such that the gear sits in the opening of the main body and that the plastic domes sit in the corresponding openings of the rigid PCB.
instructions.picture_description: Hand holding a component, aligning it into a cylindrical device body.

instructions.text:
Insert PCB_SCREWs

Attach the rigid PCB to the housing by inserting the two PCB_SCREWs.
instructions.picture_description: Hand positioning screws into the rigid PCB to attach it to the housing.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Checking Mounting Quality: Make sure the PCB cannot move at all after the insertion of the screws.
instructions.picture_description: Two images of a person holding and screwing a PCB into a device.

instructions.text: Connecting Flexible PCB to PPCBA: 1. Put the flex PCB into the connector 2. Flip the fastener to lock the PCB
instructions.picture_description: Two images showing the connection of the flexible PCB to PPCBA

instructions.text: Positioning the White Sticker: Place the WHITE_STICKER on the back of the flexible PCB.
Confidential & Proprietary
Ensure the connection and positioning of the component shown in the image. Check the alignment as indicated.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing connection of a ribbon cable to a board.

instructions.text: Maintain a gap of 1.5mm as shown in the image for proper alignment.
instructions.picture_description: Close-up image showing a 1.5mm gap indication.

instructions.text: Insert the assembly into the housing, ensuring proper alignment as shown in two images.
instructions.picture_description: Images showing component insertion into the housing.

instructions.text: Scan the EMS assigned PCBA serial number which can be found as a sticker or engraved on the component.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing location of the PCBA serial number on the circuit board.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Print the DEVICE_LABEL in accordance with the label printing instructions DEVICE_LABEL_LPI.
instructions.picture_description: Two images showing a label printer and a sample device label.

instructions.text: Attach the printed DEVICE_LABEL into the back of the main body.
instructions.picture_description: Image of the back of the main body with a space for the label.

instructions.text: Position the flexible PCBA in display area using the yellow marked 2 locators. Make sure the FPCBA slides under the green marked edge.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing a hand holding the device with visible yellow and green markers.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Position the LIGHT_BLOCKER in display area using the 2 locators.
instructions.picture_description: Hand holding a device with a black component on top.

instructions.text: Attention: LIGHT_BLOCKER differs depending on target SKU.
Confidential & Proprietary

Push DISPLAY_RING onto MAIN_BODY.

Make sure the display engraving (can be seen on the inside of the display ring) sits on the same side as the flex pcb.
instructions.picture_description: Hand holding a cylindrical device with a black display ring being pushed onto it.

instructions.text: Attach BATTERY_COVER to MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Close-up of the bottom of the device with a white battery cover being attached.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Put HINGE into hole to hold the BATTERY_COVER.
instructions.picture_description: A hand holding a component with a hinge being inserted into a battery cover.

instructions.text: Push the DISPLAY_RING completely down.
instructions.picture_description: A hand pushing down a ring on the device.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Push the WHEEL onto the main body.
instructions.picture_description: A person attaching a wheel to a white cylindrical device.

instructions.text: Snap the FRONT_CAP onto the MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Two images: One showing a circuit board with an indicated area, the other showing a front cap being attached to a white cylindrical device.

instructions.text: Print the SETUP_LABEL in accordance with the label printing instructions SETUP_LABEL_LPI.
instructions.picture_description: A label printer printing a device label.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Place the SETUP_LABEL on the WHEEL.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the setup label attached to a cylindrical device with a knob on top.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Remove the Mounting Bracket
instructions.picture_description: An image of a detached mounting bracket.

instructions.text: Scan the Rear Serial Number. The station starts the EOL procedure.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the rear of the device with a highlighted serial number area.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Scan the Front Serial Number
instructions.picture_description: Close-up image of a device with the serial number highlighted in red.

instructions.text:
Insert Batteries

Open the battery compartment cover.
Insert the AA BATTERIES.
Close the battery compartment cover.
instructions.picture_description: Image of a person inserting AA batteries into the device's battery compartment.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Wait for EOL on display.
instructions.picture_description: A device displaying 'EOL' on its screen.

instructions.text: If DUT shows FAI, don't proceed, station should show FAIL.
Press the pairing button.
instructions.picture_description: The back of the device with the pairing button circled in red.

instructions.text: DUT shows 00.
Confidential & Proprietary

Turn the wheel to the right until all LEDs turn on.
1) DUT counts up
2) DUT turns on all LEDs above maximum
instructions.picture_description: Cylinder with a right-pointing arrow on its base.

instructions.text:
Turn wheel to the left until all LEDs turn off.
1) DUT counts down
2) DUT turns off all LEDs below minimum
instructions.picture_description: Cylinder with a left-pointing arrow on its base.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Attach the Mounting Bracket
instructions.picture_description: Image of a metal mounting bracket on a flat surface.

instructions.text:
Mount DUT using its adapter on the stand
1) DUT shows CAL.
2) DUT performs calibration.
instructions.picture_description: Image of the DUT mounted on a stand and a display showing 'CAL'.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Wait for PA or FAIL on DUT. The station should show PASS or FAIL.
instructions.picture_description: Images showing 'PA' with a green check mark and 'FAIL'.

instructions.text: Remove DUT from stand.
instructions.picture_description: Picture of a device placed on a stand.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Remove the Mounting Bracket from the device main body.
instructions.picture_description: A close-up image of a device part with the mounting bracket removed.

instructions.text: Open & Close the battery cover to interrupt the power supply.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a hand holding a device with an open battery cover, revealing batteries inside.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary

Checking for Customer Mode

Check that the display shows the temperature when turning the wheel.

Attention: If the device shows "E0L", the EOL test has not been completed.
instructions.picture_description: Two images showing device displays: one with temperature, another with 'E0L' warning.

instructions.text:
Placing the Battery Tab

Open the battery compartment again.

Place the BATTERY_TAB as shown.

Close the battery compartment cover back.

Attention: The battery tab must break the electric contact.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing placement of battery tab in the compartment.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Close battery door
instructions.picture_description: Image showing a device with a battery compartment and a blue arrow indicating the part to close.

instructions.text: Check Wheel on Torque Meter - Max allowed: 40mNm
instructions.picture_description: Image showing a torque meter with a wheel being checked.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Wrap the Device(s) in PROTECTIVE_FOIL.
instructions.picture_description: A person wrapping a device with protective foil.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
Get between the Front Cap and the Wheel with a plastic tool at the red marked area. Note: DO NOT USE METAL. It will damage the wheel.
instructions.picture_description: Plastic tool inserted between Front Cap and Wheel at marked area.

instructions.text: Push the Front Cap up with the plastic tool until the lift side is fully lift.
instructions.picture_description: Front Cap is partially lifted with a plastic tool.

instructions.text: Now you can pull up the Front cap with your hands. Throw the Front Cap away.
instructions.picture_description: Front Cap is removed completely, showing inside of the device.

instructions.text: Confidential & Proprietary
